pageContent: Background: In 2012, the United States Preventive Services Task Force (USPSTF) recommended against prostate-specific antigen (PSA) screening, despite evidence that Black men are at a higher risk of prostate cancer-specific mortality (PCSM). We evaluated whether Black men of potentially screening-eligible age (55-69 years) are at a disproportionally high risk of poor outcomes.

metaData.source:
Predicting outcomes in patients with urologic cancers
https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/18685357/
